Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Seal
Description: Small oblong-shaped seal carved from a fine pottery sherd with beige surfaces and black cross-section. The upper extremity has been pierced for suspension.  A criss-cross pattern was deeply engraved on the rectangular base. This object is reminiscent of Kerma and Second Intermediate Period seals.
